ðŸ’¡ shellfirm | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Preventing accidental or malicious execution of dangerous shell commands.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intercepts risky shell commands. â€¢ Prompts users with a challenge for verification. â€¢ Provides a captcha-like system for the terminal. â€¢ Supports multiple shells (Zsh, Bash, Fish). â€¢ Uses customizable risky patterns.
ðŸ“– Summary: Shellfirm is a security tool that intercepts potentially dangerous shell commands and prompts the user with a verification challenge before execution. It acts as a safety net, preventing accidental or malicious actions in the terminal. Shellfirm supports various shells and allows customization of risky command patterns.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ captcha-solver-on-Adroid | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Solving CAPTCHAs on Android devices using external CAPTCHA solving services.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Android-based CAPTCHA solving client â€¢ Supports reCAPTCHA and funCAPTCHA â€¢ Uses CAPTCHA solving services like Deathbycaptcha and 2captcha â€¢ Provides a user-friendly Android interface for CAPTCHA solving
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides an Android client for solving CAPTCHAs, specifically reCAPTCHA and funCAPTCHA, by leveraging external CAPTCHA solving services like Deathbycaptcha and 2captcha. It aims to offer a user-friendly interface for Android users who need to automate CAPTCHA solving tasks, filling the gap where service providers only offer APIs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ caffeine | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: High-performance, near-optimal caching of data in Java applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ In-memory cache â€¢ Automatic loading of entries â€¢ Size-based eviction â€¢ Time-based expiration â€¢ Asynchronous refresh
ðŸ“– Summary: Caffeine is a high-performance caching library for Java that provides an in-memory cache with features like automatic loading, size-based eviction, time-based expiration, and asynchronous refresh. It offers flexible configuration options and extensions for JCache, Guava, and simulation, making it suitable for various caching scenarios in Java applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ osgint | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) gathering on GitHub users, specifically finding usernames from emails and vice versa, and retrieving profile information.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Find GitHub username from an email â€¢ Find email from GitHub username â€¢ Find information about a profile (account creation date, public gists, id, public pgp, public ssh)
ðŸ“– Summary: OSGINT is a Python tool designed for gathering information about GitHub users. It allows users to find a GitHub username given an email address, and attempt to find an email address given a username. It also retrieves various profile details such as account creation date, public gists, and public SSH keys.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ chatgpt-chrome-extension | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enhancing text input across the internet using ChatGPT for tasks like writing, revising, and debugging.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Integrates ChatGPT into every text box on the internet â€¢ Plugin system for greater control over ChatGPT behavior â€¢ Ability to interact with 3rd party APIs
ðŸ“– Summary: This Chrome extension seamlessly integrates ChatGPT into any text box, enabling users to leverage its capabilities for various writing and editing tasks directly within their browser. It also features a plugin system, allowing for customized behavior and interaction with external APIs, extending its functionality.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ clickclickclick | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating tasks on Android and computers using LLMs.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Autonomous Android and computer use â€¢ LLM integration (local or remote) â€¢ Web interface (Gradio) â€¢ CLI tool â€¢ API access
ðŸ“– Summary: ClickClickClick is a framework that enables autonomous control of Android devices and computers using Large Language Models. It supports local and remote LLMs, including Ollama, Gemini, and GPT 4o. The framework can be used via a web interface (Gradio), a command-line interface, or through scripting, providing flexible options for automating various tasks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ FinanceToolkit | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Transparent and efficient financial analysis, enabling users to calculate financial ratios and metrics with clear, auditable methodologies.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Financial ratio calculations (150+)
ðŸ“– Summary: FinanceToolkit is a Python library designed for transparent financial analysis. It provides a comprehensive set of tools for calculating financial ratios, retrieving historical data for various asset classes, and measuring performance and risk. The toolkit emphasizes transparency by providing clear methodologies for all calculations, allowing users to avoid reliance on opaque, proprietary data sources.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ minecraft | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating a Minecraft clone from scratch using OpenGL and Go, without relying on game engines or frameworks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Infinite and procedurally generated terrain â€¢ Physics engine with collision detection â€¢ Day/night cycle â€¢ Dynamic lighting â€¢ Block placement and destruction
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a from-scratch implementation of Minecraft using Go and OpenGL. It features procedurally generated terrain, a physics engine, dynamic lighting, and block manipulation. The project demonstrates how to build a 3D voxel game engine from the ground up, focusing on performance and custom implementations.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ ophiuchi-desktop | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing local HTTPS proxy servers using Docker containers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Local HTTPS proxy server management â€¢ Docker-based proxy server creation and management â€¢ GUI for managing proxy settings
ðŸ“– Summary: Ophiuchi Desktop is a tool for managing local HTTPS proxy servers. It leverages Docker to create and manage isolated proxy environments, providing a user-friendly interface for configuring and controlling these proxies.
